intro: Dianthus serpentinus, commonly known as the serpentine campion, is a flowering plant native to rocky, calcareous soils in the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and have five petals with distinctive notches. Dianthus serpentinus is adapted to poor, well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
